passages.text: Maintain Rating: UNDERPERFORM | PO: 11.39 CNY | Price: 13.75 CNY

SPDB's 1H revenue/net profit grew \(2.6\% /10.2\%\) YoY \((vs + 1.3\% / + 1.0\%\) in 1Q), as pre- guided. 1H PPOP increased \(4.2\%\) YoY \((vs + 1.4\%\) in 1Q). ROE rose 0.3ppt YoY to \(8.7\%\) in 1H. CET1 ratio rose 4bp YoY to \(8.91\%\) . SPDB would be able to promote a full conversion of its CBs if its share price stays above RMB13.761 by maturity (28 Oct 2025) or promote a mandatory conversion of its CBs if its share price stays above RMB16.263 for at least 15 out of 30 consecutive trading days. SPDB is now trading at one of the highest P/B to ROE multiples and offering one of the lowest dividend yields among banks under our coverage. It will likely see notable dilution and its profit growth advantage over peers will likely narrow notably post its potential CB conversion. Maintain Underperform.

NII rose \(4.2\%\) QoQ, with gross interest income/expense down \(0.8\% /4.4\%\) . We estimate NIM to rebound 3bp QoQ to \(1.43\%\) in 2Q. Assets/loans both grew \(1.0\%\) QoQ and their YoY growth decelerated from \(5.5\% /7.6\%\) in 1Q to \(4.2\% /6.0\%\) in 2Q. Corporate loans grew \(10.4\%\) HoH, retail loans rose \(1.3\%\) (mortgage/card loans \(+1.9\% /2.1\%)\) and disc. bills dropped \(35\%\) . Deposits grew \(2.3\%\) QoQ and their YoY growth accelerated from \(11.0\%\) in 1Q to \(12.0\%\) in 2Q. LDR remained high at \(101\%\) . Net fee income fell \(1\%\) YoY in 1H \((vs + 0.0\%\) in 1Q), with growth in agency/trust fees \((+10\% / + 21\%)\) more than offset by decline in card/IB fees \((- 12\% / - 14\%)\) . Other non- interest income grew \(12.3\%\) YoY in 1H \((vs + 4.5\%\) in 1Q). OPEX fell \(1.3\%\) YoY and CIR fell \(1.1\) ppt YoY to \(27.9\%\) in 1H.

NPLs fell \(0.8\%\) QoQ and NPL ratio fell 2bp QoQ to \(1.31\%\) . Gross NPL formation was 76bp in 1H25 vs 86bp/90bp in 1H/FY24. Corporate NPL ratio fell 15bp HoH to \(1.34\%\) (developer loan NPL ratio up 107bp HoH to \(3.57\%\) ), while retail NPL ratio rose 4bp HoH to \(1.65\%\) with NPL ratio increasing across all products except for card loans. Credit cost was 97bp in 1H25 (vs 93bp/107bp in 1H/FY24). Non- loan provisions declined \(35\%\) YoY to RMB5.6bn. Loan reserve/NPL coverage ratio rose 5bp/7ppt QoQ to \(2.54\% /194\%\) .

Banks-Multinational/Universal

Shanghai Pudong Development Bank (SPDB) is a joint- stock bank in China, with total assets of RMB1.62tn (US\$250bn) as of end- 2009. SPDB was founded in 1993 with the Shanghai government as a major promoter, and was listed on the Shanghai Stock Exchange in 1999. SPDB is a full- service bank, employing over 20,000 people and operating over 600 branches nationwide. Citigroup is the only foreign strategic investor, with a stake of less than \(4\%\) .

We rate SPDB Underperform for the relatively high risks in its balance sheet. SPDB's core profitability (PPROA) and profitability (ROE) had been declining quickly since 2015, and we see no turnaround in the near term. Its liquidity position remained very tight with loan- deposit ratio \(>100\%\) and interbank liabilities (incl. NCD) made up around \(30\%\) of total liabilities. Gross NPL formation remained high and NPL coverage was low among peers.

Our PO of CNY11.39 is based on \(0.47\times 2025 - 26E\) P/B, which is derived from an adjusted Gordon Growth model that assumes a medium- term ROE of \(8.5\%\) , a medium- term growth rate of \(4.0\%\) , and a cost of equity of \(13.5\%\) . At our PO, the stock would be trading at 7.0x 2025- 26E P/E or 2.7x 2025- 26E P/PPOP.
Downside risks to our PO are sharp margin decline, higher than expected NPL formation and credit costs, and capital requirement by the regulators.
Upside risks to our PO are stronger- than- expected margin performance, continued high asset growth, and lower- than- expected NPL formation.
